content:
• Thursday, June 6, 2019

  • Vertex Pharma +4.3% on Exonics acquisition; Crispr rises on deal

    • Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX) is up 4.3% after hours following the announcement that it's expanding gene editing capabilities by acquiring Exonics Therapeutics and entering a licensing deal with Crispr Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CRSP).
    • Crispr is up 10.9% after hours.
    • Vertex will acquire privately held Exonics for an upfront payment of $245M along with potential milestone payments.
    • Meanwhile, Vertex will pay $175M upfront for exclusive worldwide rights to Crispr's "existing and future intellectual property including foundational CRISPR/Cas9 technology, novel endonucleases, single and double cut guide RNAs, and AAV vectors for DMD and DM1 gene editing products."
    • The moves enhance Vertex's capability to develop novel therapies for Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy and Myotonic Dystrophy Type 1, the company says.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM | 9 Comments
  • CTHR

    Charles & Colvard files for equity offering; shares -16%

    • Charles & Colvard (NASDAQ:CTHR) has filed a prospectus to offer shares through Roth Capital Partners.
    • The size of the offering is yet undetermined.
    • Proceeds will go to marketing and for general purposes.
    • Earlier, the company offered Q4 and fiscal 2019 net sales guidance and said it would report results in early September.
    • Shares are now down 15.8% after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:09 PM | 12 Comments

  • DOCU, BYND, CRSP and GES among notable after hour movers

    • Top Gainers: ZUMZ +17.3%. BYND +14.3%. ZM +10%. CRSP +8.5%. ELGX +4%.
    • Top Losers: DOCU -20.5%. DOMO -18.1%. OLLI -3.1%. GES -1.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:48 PM
  • CTHR

    Charles & Colvard down 16% on Q419 and FY guidance

    • Charles & Colvard (NASDAQ:CTHR) expects net sales for its Q4 and full-year fiscal 2019 to be in the range of $7.0 - $7.2M ($6.4M prior) and $31.6 to $31.8M, respectively.
    • Shares -16% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • PD

    Pagerduty +5% on upside FY20 outlook

    • Pagerduty (NYSE:PD) gains 5% after its first earnings print after the IPO. PD beat Q1 estimates with a 49% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • The Q2 outlook has upside revenue of $38.5-$39.5M (consensus: $37.12M) and in-line loss per share of $0.10 to $0.09 (consensus: $0.10 loss).
    • The upside FY20 view has revenue of $161-163M and loss per share of $0.38 to $0.37.
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 7 Comments
  • DOMO

    Domo -18.9% on downside Q2 revenue view

    • Domo (NASDAQ:DOMO) craters 18.9% after the Q1 results were washed away by a downside Q2 revenue forecast of $41-42M (estimate: $42.3M) with an in-line loss per share of $1.02 to $0.98 (estimate: $1.00 loss).
    • The FY20 view has a narrower than expected loss per share of $3.87 to $3.79 (estimate: $4.02 loss) and in-line revenue of $173-174M (estimate: $173.9M).
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 42 Comments
  • GES

    Guess +4% after Americas segment shines

    • Guess (NYSE:GES) trades 4.05% higher in AH trading after matching estimates with its Q1 report.
    • Results in the Americas segment impressed, with retail comparable sales up 4% and operating margin up 230 bps compared to a year ago.
    • "During the quarter we were also able to complete a convertible debt transaction at very favorable terms to deploy funds to buy back company shares," notes CEO Carlos Alberini.
    • Looking ahead, Guess anticipates FY20 revenue growth of +3.5% to +4.5% vs. +4% to +5% prior view and EPS of $1.19 to $1.30 vs. $1.18 consensus.
    • Previously: Guess EPS beats by $0.01, revenue in-line (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZM

    Zoom +10.8% on upside full-year outlook

    • Zoom Video (NASDAQ:ZM) soars 10.8% on its first post-IPO print. The Q1 results beat estimates with 103% Y/Y revenue growth.
    • The Q2 view has upside revenue of $129-130M (estimate: $122.3M) and in-line EPS of $0.01 to $0.02 (estimate: $0.01).
    • Upside FY guidance has revenue of $535-540M (estimate: $522.2M) and EPS of $0.02 to $0.03 (estimate: $0.01).
    • The number of customers contributing more than $100K in the trailing 12 months grew 120% Y/Y to 405.
    • Earnings call starts at 5 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM | 27 Comments
  • SB

    Safe Bulkers unveils stock buyback plan

    • Safe Bulkers (NYSE:SB) +9.1% after-hours on news it authorized a 5M-share repurchase program.
    • SB says the program would represent 4.9% of the shares of its common stock outstanding and 9.7% of its public float if the maximum number of shares are purchased.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 4 Comments
  • OLLI

    Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings -2% after earnings

    • Ollie's Bargain Outlet Holdings (NASDAQ:OLLI) reports comparable sales rose 0.8% in Q1 to fall short of the consensus estimate +1.5%.
    • Gross margin was 40.9% of sales vs. 40.9% a year ago.
    • Adjusted operating income fell 70 bps to 12.4% of sales as a result of the deleveraging of Ollie's pre-opening expenses.
    • The Company opened 21 stores during the quarter, ending the period with a total of 324 stores in 23 states (+17.4% Y/Y).
    • Looking ahead, Ollie's sees FY20 revenue of $1.44B to $1.453B vs. $1.45B consensus and EPS $2.13 to $2.17 vs. $2.15 consensus.
    • OLLI -1.55% AH to $96.05.
    • Previously: Ollie's Bargain Outlet EPS beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • DOCU

    DocuSign -16% on subscription deceleration

    • DocuSign (NASDAQ:DOCU) plunges 16% after the Q1 beats arrived with signs of slight subscription deceleration.
    • In-line Q2 guidance that has $218-222M in revenue (estimate: $219.9M) and billings of $215-225M.
    • The upside FY20 outlook has $917-922M (estimate: $913.65M) and billings of $1.01-1.03B.
    • In Q1, subscription revenue was up 36% Y/Y to $201.5M, down from the 37% growth in Q4, while professional services gained 64% to $12.5M. Billings totaled $215M, up 27%.
    • The adjusted gross margin was 79%, down one percentage point from last year's quarter. The subscription margin was flat on the year at 86%.
    • Cash from operating activities came in at $45.7M compared to the $15M last year. FCF was $30.4M versus $8.8M.
    • Earnings call starts at 4:30 PM ET with a webcast here.
    • Press release.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM | 65 Comments
  • XERS

    FDA extends action date 90 days for Xeris Pharma's glucagon rescue pen

    • The FDA has extended its action date to September 10 for its review of Xeris Pharmaceuticals' (NASDAQ:XERS) marking application for Gvoke (ready-to-use glucagon injection) for the treatment of severe hypoglycemia (low blood sugar).
    • The 90-day extension is standard operating procedure for the agency when there is a major amendment to an NDA. In this case, additional information requested by the review team constituted such an amendment.
    • Management will host a conference call today at 5:00 pm ET to discuss the situation.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:23 PM
  • BYND

    Beyond Meat rallies after first post-IPO earnings report

    • Shares of Beyond Meat (NASDAQ:BYND) are up 5.10% in AH trading after the plant-based meat producer reports sales growth of 215% in Q1.
    • An adjusted EBITDA loss of $2.1M was reported for the quarter vs. -$4.3M a year ago.
    • Gross profit was 26.8% of sales vs. 16.1% a year ago.
    • Looking ahead, Beyond Meat expects FY19 revenue to $210M and for adjusted EBITDA to break even.
    • Previously: Beyond Meat EPS beats by $0.01, beats on revenue (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZM

    Zoom Video Communications EPS beats by $0.02, beats on revenue

    • Zoom Video Communications (NASDAQ:ZM): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.02; GAAP EPS of $0.00 beats by $0.02.
    • Revenue of $121.99M (+103.1% Y/Y) beats by $10.36M.
    • Shares +5.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 9 Comments
  • GES

    Guess EPS beats by $0.01, revenue in-line

    • Guess (NYSE:GES): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.25 beats by $0.01; GAAP EPS of -$0.27 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $536.69M (+3.0% Y/Y) in-line.
    • Shares +2.68%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • MTN

    Vail Resorts +2% after profit beat

    • Vail Resorts (NYSE:MTN) reports total lift revenue increased 16.4% in Q1, driven by a 14.3% growth in skier visitation primarily from Triple Peaks and Stevens Pass.
    • Mountain reported EBITDA was up 14.4% during the quarter, primarily due to strong North American pass sales growth for the 2018/2019 North American ski season.
    • Looking ahead, Vail is now expecting resort reported EBITDA for the full fiscal year to be between $700M to $710M.
    • Shares of Vail are up 1.71% in AH trading.
    • Previously: Vail Resorts EPS beats by $0.04, revenue in-line (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:12 PM
  • BYND

    Beyond Meat EPS beats by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Beyond Meat (NASDAQ:BYND): Q1 Non-GAAP EPS of -$0.14 beats by $0.01; GAAP EPS of -$0.95 misses by $0.80.
    • Revenue of $40.21M (+214.6% Y/Y) beats by $1.28M.
    • Shares +4.91%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM | 157 Comments
  • VLO

    The worst is over for top U.S. refiners, Goldman says in Valero upgrade

    • Valero Energy (VLO +2%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $96 price target at Goldman Sachs, as analyst Neil Mehta sees an opportunity to buy into higher quality U.S. refiners at a discount after the group pulled back ~10% in the past month.
    • Mehta sees underappreciated value in the renewable diesel segment given the focus on emissions reductions globally, and thinks VLO is positively leveraged to the IMO's 2020 emissions reduction rules.
    • VLO also should benefit from increased flows of crude to the U.S. Gulf Coast, where much of VLO's refining capacity is located, and Mehta finds the stock's valuation compelling at current levels, with a dividend yield approaching 5% and projected free cash flow yield of 10% through next year.
    • Mehta also likes Marathon Petroleum (MPC +0.9%) - which is on Goldman's Conviction Buy List - as well as Buy-rated Phillips 66 (PSX +0.4%) and Par Pacific (PARR -0.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 30 Comments
  • SAIC

    Easy earnings topper, 37% revenue rise, lift SAIC to YTD high

    • Science Applications International (SAIC +6.4%) surges to its highest level since September after handily beating Q1 earnings estimates on in-line revenues, which jumped 37% Y/Y to $1.62B.
    • Excluding acquired revenues, the total fell by 2.8% in the quarter, attributable to humanitarian relief materials in the prior-year quarter and the affect of acquisition-related revenue dis-synergies.
    • SAIC says Q1 contract awards totaled $1B and net bookings came in at $1.4B, with 70% of the net bookings for new business; estimated backlog of signed business orders at quarter-end was ~$13.6B.
    • SAIC reaffirms its FY 2020 outlook, including its free cash flow target of $425M, although given the strength of its Q1 performance, the company believes it can meet or exceed the goal for the year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 1 Comment
  • EWW

    Progress on Mexico boosts stocks

    • The Washington Post reports on the beginnings of a possible agreement in which National Guard troops would be deployed along the Guatemalan border to halt migrants looking to move north.
    • The news has given an afternoon lift to the previously flat averages, with the S&P 500 up 0.7% and Nasdaq up 0.6%.
    • The iShares Mexico ETF (NYSEARCA:EWW) remains 0.7% lower for the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 53 Comments
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris to downsize German staff; shares down 7%

    • Citing its aim to right-size its operations in Frankfurt, Germany to better reflect the size of the business there, Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS -7.4%) will terminate eight positions. The company expects to pay ~$800K in severance costs by January 31, 2020, connected to the move.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM

  • Barnes & Noble seen going private for $476M

    • Elliott Management is close to striking a deal to pay $6.50 per share for Barnes & Noble, sources tell Financial Times. That deal price would value the retailer at $476M.
    • Shares of BKS are up 31.6% to $6.05 after trading at a 52-week low of $4.11 earlier in the session.
    • Previously: Barnes & Noble spikes on WSJ report of sale (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM

  • CIEN, CMTL and CLDR among notable tech movers

    • Gainers: Ciena Corporation (NYSE:CIEN) +25%. Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) +17%. Orion Energy Systems (NASDAQ:OESX) +16%. Ideanomics (NASDAQ:IDEX) +12%. IDT Corporation (NYSE:IDT) +11%.
    • Losers: Cloudera (NYSE:CLDR) -40%. Vislink Technologies (NASDAQ:VISL) -18%. Gravity (NASDAQ:GRVY) -18%. TuanChe (NASDAQ:TC) -15%. Riot Blockchain (NASDAQ:RIOT) -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 4 Comments
  • APRN

    Selling pressure on Blue Apron doesn't relent

    • Blue Apron (NYSE:APRN) is down 3.11% on the day and traded at a 52-week low of $0.63 earlier in the session.
    • The sell-side community has whiffed on Blue Apron but still has a consensus Hold rating on Blue Apron (8 ratings), while the two Seeking Alpha Authors with articles on Blue Apron have been on the right side of the trade at Very Bearish.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • LLEX

    Lilis Energy Chairman/CEO Ormand retires; Daches named interim CEO

    • Lilis Energy (LLEX -8.2%) is lower after naming President and CFO Joe Daches as interim CEO with the retirement of Chairman and CEO Ron Ormand, effective today, and selects David Wood as its new board chairman.
    • Ormand became Lilis CEO in April 2018 and was a co-founder and senior executive at Magnum Hunter Resources, highlighting 34 years of experience as a senior executive and investment banker in the energy sector.
    • Daches joined Lilis in 2016 and became Executive VP, CFO and Treasurer in early 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:18 PM
  • SHOP

    Shopify gets target boost on 'over-hyped' competition

    • KeyBanc raises its Shopify (NYSE:SHOP) target from $275 to $300, matching the Street-high target. The rating stays at Buy.
    • The bank cites "over-hyped" concerns about competition from Magento, which Adobe (ADBE +0.3%) acquired last year. Analyst Josh Beck says the market has room for both companies.
    • Beck sees a path for Magento to gain a 9% share while Shopify picks up 2% with minimal overlap.
    • Upcoming catalyst: Shopify's Unite conference takes place June 18-20.
    • Shopify shares are up 1.9% to $298.15.
    • Shopify has an Outperform average Sell Side rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 103 Comments
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble spikes on WSJ report of sale

    • Trading in Barnes & Noble (BKS +19.2%) has been halted after volatility spiked following a Wall Street Journal report indicating that a sale of the retailer to Elliott Management is imminent.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 28 Comments

  • Only U.S. Gold in Energy/Materials gainers; Mammoth Energy Services and Key Energy Services among losers

    • Gainers: U.S. Gold (NASDAQ:USAU) +10%.
    • Losers: Mammoth Energy Services (NASDAQ:TUSK) -38%. Key Energy Services (NYSE:KEG) -10%. Profire Energy (NASDAQ:PFIE) -7%.Quintana Energy Services (NYSE:QES) -7%.Torchlight Energy Resources (NASDAQ:TRCH) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • SNAP

    Snap +5.2% as Pivotal upgrades to Buy

    • Snap (NYSE:SNAP) has moved up to its highest point since last July, up 5.2%, following an upgrade to Buy at Pivotal Research.
    • The firm boosted from a previous Hold rating and raised its price target to $17.25 from $13.25, now implying 27% upside.
    • That would make it an even half-dozen firms at a Buy-equivalent rating, vs. a few dozen at Hold and another half-dozen at Sell.
    • And that makes the average sell-side rating a Hold, while Quant ratings match that at Neutral and Seeking Alpha authors are Bearish overall.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 43 Comments

  • American Superconductor and Hovnanian Enterprises among industrial losers

    • Gainers: None
    • Losers: MICT (NASDAQ:MICT) -26%. American Superconductor (NASDAQ:AMSC) -17%. Hovnanian Enterprises (NYSE:HOV) -11%. Aqua Metals (NASDAQ:AQMS) -8%. Attis Industries (NASDAQ:ATIS) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:18 PM

  • Provident Bancorp leads financial gainers, Hexindai and X Financial among losers

    • Gainers: Provident Bancorp (NASDAQ:PVBC) +14%. ATIF Holdings (NASDAQ:ATIF) +10%. Carver Bancorp (NASDAQ:CARV) +6%. Mmtec (NASDAQ:MTC) +6%.
    • Losers: Mr. Cooper Group (NASDAQ:COOP) -7%. Ashford Hospitality Trust (NYSE:AHT) -7%. Hexindai (NASDAQ:HX) -6%. MoneyGram International (NASDAQ:MGI) -6%. X Financial (NYSE:XYF) -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:57 PM | 1 Comment

  • CIEN, SFIX, HOME and CLDR among midday movers

    • Gainers: La Jolla Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:LJPC) +87%. ContraVir Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CTRV) +74%. Ciena Corporation (NYSE:CIEN) +24%. Cidara Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CDTX) +21%. Dynatronics Corporation (NASDAQ:DYNT) +16%. Stitch Fix (NASDAQ:SFIX) +15%. Eloxx Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ELOX) +15%. Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL) +15%. OncoSec Medical Incorporated (NASDAQ:ONCS) +15%. Orion Energy Systems (NASDAQ:OESX) +14%.
    • Losers: Eros International (NYSE:EROS) -54%. At Home Group (NYSE:HOME) -50%. Kirkland's (NASDAQ:KIRK) -47%. Motif Bio (NASDAQ:MTFB) -45%. Cloudera (NYSE:CLDR) -42%. Mammoth Energy Services (NASDAQ:TUSK) -36%. Benitec Biopharma (NASDAQ:BNTC) -35%. MICT (NASDAQ:MICT) -28%. Xeris Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:XERS) -24%. ReWalk Robotics (NASDAQ:RWLK) -22%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • BKS

    Sentiment sours again on Barnes & Noble

    • Barnes & Noble (NYSE:BKS) is down 7.42% and trades just pennies above the 52-week low a day after retailer GameStop went into a post-earnings nosedive.
    • On Seeking Alpha, author Max Greve warned yesterday that the true book value on BKS may be below $1. Meanwhile on Wall Street, only two firms provide coverage on the bookstore chain, with both sitting on Buy-equivalent ratings.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:26 PM | 4 Comments
  • VRNT

    Verint holder drops proxy fight

    • Verint Systems (VRNT -0.7%) says Neuberger Berman Investment Advisers has agreed to withdraw its three board nominees.
    • The decision follows "constructive discussions," and the holder recommends other stockholders to vote for Verint's nominees.
    • Verint still plans to refinance its convertible notes and doesn't plan to settle them with shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM

  • Stock markets mixed as trade weighs against ECB moves

    • All three major U.S. stock averages take a noon dip, bringing the Nasdaq (-0.1%) into the red.
    • The S&P 500 (+0.1%) and the Dow (+0.2%) manage to stay in positive territory.
    • Investors remain wary as optimism over looser monetary policy, reaffirmed by the ECB's Mario Draghi today, is counterbalanced by trade worries.
    • Energy (+1.0%) and consumer staples (+0.5%) outperform the broader market, as industrials (-0.6%) and real estate (-0.3%) lag.
    • Treasurys resume their rally, pushing the 10-year yield down almost 3 basis points to 2.095%.
    • Crude oil falls 0.4% to $51.47 per barrel; gold rises 0.7% to $1,342.80 per ounce.
    • The Dollar Index weakens 0.5% to 96.88.
    • The euro rises 0.6% against the dollar after ECB President Draghi said the central bank will act to sustain expansion in the Euro-zone.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment

  • Tesla and Workhorse Group in consumer gainers; Amira Nature Foods and La-Z-Boy among losers

    • Gainers: Workhorse Group (NASDAQ:WKHS) +13%. Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) +6%.
    • Losers: At Home Group (NYSE:HOME) -48%. La-Z-Boy (NYSE:LZB) -12%. Libbey (NYSEMKT:LBY) -12%. Lifeway Foods (NASDAQ:LWAY) -11%. Amira Nature Foods (NYSE:ANFI) -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM
  • FCEL

    FuelCell slammed after hiring restructuring firm, dismissing CEO Bottone

    • FuelCell Energy (FCEL -33.3%) sinks to multi-year lows on disclosing it terminated President and CEO Arthur Bottone after more than eight years at the helm and that it hired Huron Consulting Services to assist restructuring and contingency planning initiatives.
    • Oppenheimer's Colin Rusch downgrades shares to Market Perform from Outperform with no price target, saying with FCEL entering into a full restructuring via Huron Consulting and the CEO terminated, the company's strategy for moving forward "has become increasingly more difficult to predict."
    • Rush says he had anticipated FCEL would restructure its debt but it is now unclear how the company will move forward both from a capital structure and management perspective.
    • Cowen analyst Jeffrey Osborne also cuts FCEL to Market Perform and lowers his price target to $1 from $2.75 following the hiring of a restructuring firm and dismissal of the CEO.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM | 19 Comments
  • CDTX

    Cidara up 18% ahead of rezafungin data presentations

    • Thinly traded nano cap Cidara Therapeutics (CDTX +18.1%) is up on more than a 5x surge in volume. Yesterday, it announced that four abstracts will be presented at ASM Microbe later this month on antifungal rezafungin (three abstracts) and influenza antiviral CB-012.
    • Rezafungin is currently being evaluated in a Phase 3 clinical trial, ReSTORE, in patients with Candida bloodstream infections and/or invasive Candida infections. A Phase 2 study, STRIVE, was successful.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • KTOS

    Kratos -1.2% as Goldman hits sidelines

    • Goldman Sachs downgrades Kratos (NASDAQ:KTOS) from Buy to Neutral but raises the price target from $22 to $24, implying a 6% increase.
    • Kratos shares are down 1.2% to $22.34.
    • KTOS has a Neutral Quant rating.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM | 6 Comments
  • MIK

    Michaels crumbles after weak profit outlook

    • Selling pressure on Michaels (MIK -12.5%) sent shares to an all-time low of $7.78 earlier in the session after the retailer's profit guidance (FY20 $2.29 to $2.41 vs. $2.44 consensus) set off some alarm bells.
    • Heading into the report, the Quant rating was flashing Bearish while the Sell-side community was in the bear camp.
    • Previously: Michaels -1% after comparable sales miss (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 4 Comments
  • CTXS

    Citrix upgraded for desktop growth potential

    • Deutsche Bank upgrades Citrix Systems (NASDAQ:CTXS) from Hold to Buy and lifts the price target by $10 to $120.
    • The firm cites improving growth in the desktop business with the segment up 13% in Q1 and "projected to be perhaps 5%-9% going forward."
    • Deutsche says Citrix is "languishing" at the current valuation.
    • Citrix shares are up 0.9% to $95.46.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • FLT

    FleetCor sold $100M-plus in 'phony carbon offsets,' Citron alleges

    • FleetCor Technologies (FLT -3.5%) tumbles after Citron Research calls the company "the largest clean energy fraud in U.S. history" and says it has "fraudulently sold well over $100M in phony carbon offsets."
    • In a new report, Citron says FLT's Clean Advantage program "is an outright 'green fraud' that has brought FleetCor to their Philidor moment and should lead to the immediate resignation of CEO Ronald Clarke."
    • "In layman's terms, FleetCor has sold enough phony carbon offsets to land their board of directors in jail for the rest of their lives," Citron says.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 5 Comments
  • TNP

    Tsakos Energy Navigation +4% after earnings topper

    • Tsakos Energy Navigation (TNP +3.7%) tracks higher after topping estimates on both lines of its Q1 report off improved market rate conditions.
    • The company's fleet averaged $21,054 per day in time charter equivalent earnings, an 18.5% increase from last year's level. During the quarter, 73% of the fleet was employed on secured revenue contracts.
    • EBITDA arrived up 53% Y/Y at $64.1M.
    • Shares of TNP are at a two-week high following the earnings release.
    • Previously: Tsakos Energy EPS beats by $0.09, beats on revenue (June 6)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM

  • ContraVir Pharmaceuticals leads healthcare gainers; ReWalk Robotics and Bellicum Pharmaceuticals among losers

    • Gainers: ContraVir Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:CTRV) +124%. La Jolla Pharmaceutical (NASDAQ:LJPC) +39%. Cidara Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CDTX) +22%. Dynatronics (NASDAQ:DYNT) +19%. Cesca Therapeutics (NASDAQ:KOOL) +14%.
    • Losers: Motif Bio (NASDAQ:MTFB) -46%. Benitec Biopharma (NASDAQ:BNTC) -23%. ReWalk Robotics (NASDAQ:RWLK) -20%. Xeris Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:XERS) -20%. Bellicum Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:BLCM) -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:02 AM | 5 Comments
  • REVG

    REV Group down 5% post Q2 earnings miss

    • REV Group (REVG -5%) reported Q2 sales of $615M (+1% Y/Y), driven by continued sales growth in both the Commercial and Recreation segments.

    • Total Backlog was at $1.4B (+9.5% Y/Y), as of April 30, 2019.
    • During the quarter company repurchased 495,475 for a total cost of $5.3M at an average price per share of $10.77.
    • FY19 Outlook: Revenue $2.4B to $2.6B; Net income $31M to $51M; Adj. net income $66M to $84M; adj. EBITDA $150M to $170M; net cash provided by operating activities of $110M to $130M; and Capex $25M to $30M.

  • LJPC

    La Jolla Pharma up 15% on positive LJPC-401 data

    • La Jolla Pharmaceutical Company (LJPC +14.5%) is up on modest volume in early trade on the heels of positive interim data from a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating LJPC-401 (synthetic human hepcidin) in patients with hereditary hemochromatosis, a disorder caused by the excessive absorption of iron from the diet that can lead to tissue and organ damage.
    • The primary endpoint is the change in blood iron levels at week 16 as measured by a laboratory test called transferrin saturation (TSAT).
    • Preliminary results on 26 patients who completed the 16-week treatment period (12 - treated, 14 - placebo) showed an average reduction in TSAT of 42% compared to an average reduction of 6% in the control group, a statistically significant separation (p<0.0001).
    • There were only three phlebotomy procedures (blood draws) in two treated patients versus 24 in nine patients in the placebo group.
    • On the safety front, the most frequent treatment-emergent adverse event was injection site reaction (79%), all mild or moderate.
    • Topline results should be available in H2.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM | 6 Comments

  • AXGT

    Axovant up 8% premarket on Parkinson's gene therapy data

    • Thinly traded micro cap Axovant Gene Therapies (NASDAQ:AXGT) is up 8% premarket on modestly higher volume in reaction to encouraging six-month follow-up data from the first dose cohort in a Phase 2 clinical trial, SUNRISE-PD, evaluating gene therapy AXO-Lenti-PD in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients.
    • At month 6, patients experienced an average improvement of 29% from baseline in a PD symptom scale called UPDRS III. The average equivalent daily dose of levodopa, the most widely used medicine to treat PD, decreased 21% from baseline while the ability to perform daily functional activities improved by an average of 18% (Rush Dyskinesia Rating Scale). ON time without dyskinesia improved 2.7 hours from baseline.
    • On the safety front, AXO-Lenti-PD was generally well-tolerated with no serious treatment-emergent adverse events reported.
    • Initial three-month data on the first patient in the second cohort should be available in Q4.
    • Data from the first child with a rare inherited lysosomal storage disorder called GM1 gangliosidosis dosed with gene therapy AXO-AAV-GM2 should be available in H2.
    • On another note, the company has terminated its license and collaboration agreement with Benitec Biopharma Ltd. (BNTC -8.9%) in its entirety (effective September 3), including gene therapy candidate AXO-AAV-OPMD, in preclinical development for oculopharyngeal muscular dystrophy.
